main event: A reddish, oval object the size of a pea was observed drifting northwest over Amarillo Air Force Base in Texas on July 13, 1956.
interesting points: The object was first seen at an azimuth of 30 degrees and an elevation of 35 degrees, and disappeared at an azimuth of 320 degrees and an elevation of 35 degrees.
The observation lasted for 1 hour and 45 minutes.
The observer was looking through a window glass.
The report concludes that the sighting was likely caused by a weather balloon released at the time of the initial report.
Weather conditions at the time included clear skies and various wind speeds at different altitudes.
sighted object: one reddish, oval object the size of a pea
